body:
I'd like to voice my strong objection to pinning anything, unless
absolutely necessary.

My main concern is security. My secondary concern are bugfixes.

npm will yell rather often if any of the packages would get a
vulnerability. We are not using npm packages which pin their dependencies,
that's our security policy. We'd have to drop using Agenda if this PR gets
merged.

Please, let's not pin production dependencies. Dev dependencies are OK to
be pinned, but I'd not recommend doing it either, since it occasionally
brings more maintenance efforts.



On Sat, 17 Oct 2020, 08:12 Alexis Tyler, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Pinning allows us to ensure we’re using the same versions when testing.
> Since we plan on having dependabot keep things up to date pinning is fine.
>
